person.name: Mark Baker
person.extras: {'org_info': 'Representative Baker is an attorney in private practice in Brandon.  He was admitted to the Mississippi Bar in 1987 and is admitted to practice in all state and federal courts in the state of Mississippi, the United States Court of Appeals for the Fifth Circuit and the United States Supreme Court.  Representative Baker is a member and past president of the Rankin County Bar Association and the Rankin County Rotary Club.  Representative Baker previously served as the prosecutor for Brandon and the municipal judge for Pelahatchie and currently serves as the board attorney for Brandon and Puckett.  Representative Baker is a former member of the Rankin County Republican Executive Committee.  Representative Baker was elected Republican Leader of the Mississippi House Republican Conference from 2008 to 2012.'}

person.name: W. Briggs Hopson III
person.extras: {'org_info': 'Senator Hopson is a member of Sigma Alpha Epsilon.  He is also a member of Mission Mississippi, Mississippi River Trail, the United Way, the Mississippi Bar and the Red Carpet Bowl.'}

person.name: Deborah Jeanne Dawkins
person.extras: {'org_info': 'Senator Dawkins is a member of the League of Women Voters, National Caucus of Environmental Legislators, America Association of University Women and USM Alumni Association.  She is on the board of directors of the Mississippi Museum of Natural Science and was Appointed by Lt. Gov Phil Bryant to the Task Force for the Elimination of Cervical Cancer.  Senator Dawkins is the first Woman to serve on the Senate Committee for Ports and Marine Resources.'}

person.name: Bob M. Dearing
person.extras: {'org_info': 'Senator Dearing is a member Natchez Festival of Music, Board Member; Natchez-Adams County Humane Society, Board Member; Mississippi-Louisiana Charter National Football Foundation and Coaches Hall of Fame; Ducks Unlimited & NRA.'}

person.name: Albert Butler
person.extras: {'org_info': 'Senator Butler is a member of Alcorn State University Alumni Association, Jackson State University Alumni Association, Omega Psi Phi Fraternity incorporated and a Mason. He is a Life Member of the NAACP.'}

person.name: Tommy A. Gollott
person.extras: {'org_info': 'Senator Gollott is a member of the Knights of Columbus and the National Society of State Legislators as a life member. His community activities include the Boys & Girls Club, Elks, Fleur De Lis Society, and a board member of the Mississippi Arts Fair for Handicapped and Chesire Home for Handicapped.'}

person.name: Russell Jolly
person.extras: {'org_info': 'Senator Jolly is a Gideon, a Mason and a Shriner.'}

person.name: Derrick T. Simmons
person.extras: {'org_info': 'Senator Simmons is a trial lawyer and is affiliated with the American Bar Association, National Bar Association, Mississippi Bar, Magnolia Bar, District of Columbia Bar and Greenville Rotary Club.  Senator Simmons is a Mason and life member of Kappa Alpha Psi Fraternity, Inc.  Senator Simmons also sits on the Mississippi Technology Alliance Liaison Committee.'}

person.name: Sollie B. Norwood
person.extras: {'org_info': 'Senator Norwood is a 33rd Degree Prince Hall Mason.  He is a life member of Phi Beta Sigma Fraternity Inc, the JSU National Alumni Association and the Jackson Branch NAACP.'}

person.name: John Horhn
person.extras: {'org_info': 'Senator Horhn holds memberships in Phi Beta Sigma, Sigma Alpha Epsilon, A. Philip Randolph Institute, NAACP and Leadership Jackson Alumni Association. Senator Horhn is also a board member of New Stage Theatre and Rainbow Health Food Co-op. He has appeared in several movies and television programs and is a member of the Screen Actors Guild.'}
